A team scores a point when:

	 1. The ball lands in the opponents' court 

	 2. An opponent commits a fault 

	 3. An opponent receives a penalty 


 Types of faults: 

	 - Out of bounds: Player contacts a ball to send it out of bounds 

	 - Foot fault: Foot crossing line during serve or back-row hit 

	 - Center line fault: Foot completely over line during front-row attack 

	 - Net fault: Player touches the net at any time 

	 - Rotational fault: Players begin a rally out of position 

	 - Interference: Player reaches over the net before the 3rd touch 

	 - Carrying: Player redirects ball without a clean contact 

	 - Lifting/holding: Ball comes to rest during player's contact 

	 - Double contact: Player contacts the ball twice consecutively 

	 - Four hits: Team fails to return the ball in three volleys
